intro: Uragoga caldasica, commonly known as the Caldasica orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or branches, exhibiting an epiphytic growth habit. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in the humid, shaded environment. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
